title: George Best
summary: George Best (22 May 1946 â€“ 25 November 2005), also known as Georgie Best, was a Northern Irish professional footballer who played as a winger, spending most of his club career at Manchester United. A highly skilful dribbler, Best is regarded as one of the best players in the history of the sport.[2][3] He was named European Footballer of the Year in 1968 and came sixth in the FIFA Player of the Century vote.[4] Best received plaudits for his playing style, which combined pace, skill, balance, feints, two-footedness, goalscoring and the ability to get past defenders.[5][6]
